Sentencas: Multi-shell graphite coated Ag nanoparticles with a core/shell structure were synthesized by using the pulsed wire evaporation (PWE) method.
Titulo: Preparation of Carbon-encapsulated Ag Nanoparticles for Dispersion in La0.6Sr0.4Co0.3Fe0.7O3-δ

Sentencas: Ar and CH4 (10 vol.%) gases were mixed in a chamber and played the roles of the carrier and the reaction gas, respectively.
Titulo: Preparation of Carbon-encapsulated Ag Nanoparticles for Dispersion in La0.6Sr0.4Co0.3Fe0.7O3-δ

Sentencas: Graphite layers were indiscretely coated on the surfaces of the silver nanoparticles.
Titulo: Preparation of Carbon-encapsulated Ag Nanoparticles for Dispersion in La0.6Sr0.4Co0.3Fe0.7O3-δ

Sentencas: However, the graphite layers detached when the particles were heated to 250 degrees C in an air atmosphere.
Titulo: Preparation of Carbon-encapsulated Ag Nanoparticles for Dispersion in La0.6Sr0.4Co0.3Fe0.7O3-δ

Sentencas: In contrast, the graphite-coated layer remained intact under an inert gas of Ar and N-2 even when the core/shell-structured particles were heated to 800 degrees C.
Titulo: Preparation of Carbon-encapsulated Ag Nanoparticles for Dispersion in La0.6Sr0.4Co0.3Fe0.7O3-δ

Sentencas: The multi-shell graphite-coated Ag nanoparticles well dispersed in La(0.6)Sr(0.4)Co(0.3)Pe(0.7)O(3-delta) (LSCF) cathode after sintering at temperatures up to 850 degrees C.
Titulo: Preparation of Carbon-encapsulated Ag Nanoparticles for Dispersion in La0.6Sr0.4Co0.3Fe0.7O3-δ

Sentencas: The graphite shell layer prevents agglomeration between Ag nanoparticles in LSCF layer.
Titulo: Preparation of Carbon-encapsulated Ag Nanoparticles for Dispersion in La0.6Sr0.4Co0.3Fe0.7O3-δ
